==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|gloss=-}}

===Etymology===
For {{cog|cmn|-}} and {{cog|yue|-}}, a {{bor|zh|fr|café||coffee|nocap=y}}.

For {{cog|wuu|-}}, a {{bor|zh|en|coffee|nocap=y}}.

For {{cog|nan-hok|-}} ''ko-pi'', ''ko-phi'' and {{cog|nan-teo|-}} ''go<sup>1</sup> bi<sup>5</sup>'', ''gu<sup>1</sup> bi<sup>5</sup>'', a {{bor|zh|ms|kopi||coffee|nocap=y}}.

{{etystub|zh}} <!-- more details needed for Taiwanese Min Nan ka-pi, Taiwanese Hakka kâ-pî, Teochew gia1 hui1 and Min Dong gă-pĭ -->

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# [[coffee]] {{zh-mw|杯}}
#: {{zh-x|現磨 咖啡|freshly ground '''coffee'''}}

====Usage notes====
Just like the English term '''coffee''', {{zh-l|咖啡}} can refer to coffee generically, as well as coffee beans, ground coffee, coffee powder or a cup of coffee specifically. See the derived terms listed below for these specific terms.
